details: لمَّا فرَغ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِن حُنينٍ بعَث أبا عامرٍ على جيشٍ إلى أَوْطاسٍ، فلَقِيَ دُرَيْدَ بنَ الصِّمَّةِ، فقُتِلَ دُريدٌ وهزَم الله أصحابَهُ، قال أبو موسى الأَشعريُّ: وبعَثني مع أبي عامرٍ عُبيدٍ الأَشعريِّ، فرُمِيَ أبو عامرٍ في رُكْبَتِهِ، رَماهُ جُشَمِيٌّ بِسَهمٍ فأَثْبَتَهُ في رُكبتِهِ، فانتَهيتُ إليه فقلتُ: يا عمِّ مَن رَماك؟ فأَشار إليه فقال: ذاك قاتِلي الذي رَماني. فقصدتُ له فلَحِقْتُهُ، فلمَّا رَآني وَلَّى، فاتَّبَعْتُه وجعلتُ أقولُ له: ألا تَسْتَحْيِي، ألا تَثْبُتُ، فكَفَّ، فاخْتلَفْنا ضَربتين بالسَّيفِ فقَتلتُه، ثمَّ قلتُ لأبي عامرٍ: قتَل الله صاحِبَك. قال: فانْزَعْ هذا السَّهمَ. فنَزعْتُه فنَزا منه الماءُ قال: يا ابنَ أخي أَقْرِئْ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم السَّلامَ، وقُلْ له: اسْتَغْفِرْ لي. واسْتخلَفني أبو عامرٍ على النَّاسِ، فمكَث يَسيرًا ثمَّ مات، فرجعتُ فدخلتُ على النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم في بيتِه على سَريرٍ مُرْمَلٍ وعليه فِراشٌ، قد أَثَّرَ رِمالُ السَّريرِ بِظَهْرِهِ وجَنْبَيْهِ، فأَخبرتُه بخَبرِنا وخَبرِ أبي عامرٍ، وقال: قُلْ له اسْتَغْفِرْ لي. فدَعا بماءٍ فتَوضَّأَ، ثمَّ رفَع يَديهِ فقال: «اللَّهمَّ اغْفِرْ لعُبيدٍ أبي عامرٍ». ورَأيتُ بَياضَ إِبْطَيْهِ، ثمَّ قال: «اللَّهمَّ اجْعَلْهُ يومَ القِيامةِ فوقَ كَثيرٍ مِن خَلقِك مِنَ النَّاسِ». فقلتُ: وَلِي فَاسْتَغْفِرْ. فقال: «اللَّهمَّ اغْفِرْ لعبدِ الله بنِ قَيسٍ ذَنْبَهُ، وأَدْخِلْهُ يومَ القِيامةِ مُدخَلًا كَريمًا» قال أبو بُردةَ: إحداهُما لأبي عامرٍ، والأُخرى لأبي موسى .

title: إِسلامُ عَمرِو بنِ العاصِ وخالدِ بنِ الوليدِ وعُثمانَ بنِ طلحةَ رضِي الله عنهم .
details: قال خالدُ بنُ الوليدِ: لمَّا أراد الله عزَّ وجلَّ ما أَراد مِنَ الخيرِ قذَف في قلبي الإسلامَ وحضَرني رُشدي, وقلتُ قد شَهِدتُ هذه المواطِنَ كُلَّها على محمَّدٍ صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم فليس مَوطنٌ أَشهدُه إلَّا أَنصرِفُ وأنا أَرى في نَفْسي أنِّي في غيرِ شيءٍ وأنَّ محمَّدًا سيَظهرُ، فلمَّا خرَج رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم إلى الحُديبيةِ خَرجتُ في خيلِ المشركين فقمتُ بإزائِه في عُسْفانَ وتَعرَّضتُ له، فصلَّى بأصحابِه الظُّهرَ أمامَنا فهَمَمْنا أن نُغِيرَ عليه فلم نُمَكَّنْ منه, فصلَّى بأصحابِه صلاةَ العَصرِ صلاةَ الخَوفِ فوقع ذلك مِنَّا مَوقِعًا، وقلتُ: الرَّجلُ ممنوعٌ. فافْتَرقنا, فلمَّا صالح قُريشًا بالحُديبيةِ, ثمَّ دخَل رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم مكَّةَ في عُمرَةِ القَضاءِ طَلبَني فلم يَجِدْني، وكتَب إليَّ كِتابًا فيه: بسم الله الرَّحمن الرَّحيم أمَّا بعدُ، فإنِّي لم أَرَ أَعجبَ مِن ذِهابِ رَأيكِ عنِ الإسلامِ وعَقلِكَ, ومِثلُ الإسلامِ يَجهلُه أَحدٌ؟. ثمَّ سأل عَنِّي, فقِيلَ: له يأتي الله به. فقال: ما مِثلُه جَهِلَ الإسلامَ, ولو كان يجعل نِكايتَهُ مع المسلمين على المشركين كان خيرًا له، ولَقَدَّمْناهُ على غَيرِه. فلما جاءَني كِتابُه نَشَطْتُ للخُروجِ، وزادني رَغبةً في الإسلامِ، وسَرَّني سُؤالُه عَنِّي, فلمَّا أَجمعتُ الخُروجَ إلى رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم لَقِىيتُ عُثمانَ بنَ طلحةَ فعَرضتُ عليه الإسلامَ فأَسرعَ الإجابةَ، فخرج معي حتى انتهينا إلى الهَدةِ فوَجدْنا عَمرَو بنَ العاصِ بها, فقال: مرحبًا بالقومِ. فقُلنا: وبِكَ. قال: إلى أين مَسيرُكُم؟ قُلنا: الدُّخولُ في الإسلامِ، واتِّباعُ محمَّدٍ صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم. فقال: وذاك الذي أَقدَمني. فاصْطحَبْنا جميعًا حتَّى دخَلنا المدينةَ, فلَبِسْتُ مِن صالحِ ثِيابي ثمَّ عَمدتُ إلى رسولِ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم, وقد أُخبِرَ بِنا فَسُرَّ بقُدومِنا, فما زال يَتَبَسَّمُ حين رآني حتَّى وَقفتُ عليه، فسَلَّمتُ عليه بالنُّبُوَّةِ فرَدَّ عليَّ السَّلامَ بوَجْهٍ طَلْقٍ، فقلتُ: إنِّي أَشهدُ أن لا إلَه إلَّا الله، وأنَّك رسولُ الله. فقال الحمدُ لله الذي هَداك، قد كنتُ أَرى لك عَقلًا رَجَوْتُ أن لا يُسْلِمَكَ إلَّا إلى خيرٍ. قلتُ: يا رسولَ الله قد رأيتَ ما كنتُ أشهدُ مِن تلك المواطنِ عليك، فادعُ الله يَغفِرُها لي. فقال صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم: الإسلامُ يَجُبُّ ما كان قَبلَهُ.

title: سَرِيَّةُ غالبِ بنِ عبدِ الله اللَّيثيِّ إلى أَصحابِ بَشيرِ بنِ سعدٍ بفَدَكٍ .
details: بعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى مُصابِ أَصحابِ بَشيرِ بنِ سعدٍ بفَدَكٍ سَرِيَّةَ غالبِ بنِ عبدِ الله، في مِائتي رجلٍ؛ فأصابوا مِن بني مُرَّةَ نَعَمًا، وقتلوا منهم قَتْلى.

title: سَرِيَّةَ كعبِ بنِ عُميرٍ الأنصاريِّ إلى بني قُضَاعَةَ .
details: بعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم سَرِيَّةَ ذاتِ أطلح بقِيادةِ كعبِ بنِ عُميرٍ الأنصاريِّ في خمسةَ عشرَ رجلًا إلى بني قُضَاعَةَ؛ حيث كانت قد حَشدتْ جُموعًا كَبيرةً للإغارَةِ على المسلمين، فلَقوا العَدُوَّ، فدَعَوْهُم إلى الإسلامِ، فلم يَستَجيبوا لهم، وأَرشَقوهُم بالنَّبْلِ حتَّى قُتِلوا كُلُّهم إلَّا رجلًا واحدًا، فقد ارْتُثَّ مِن بين القَتْلى.

title: سَرِيَّةُ شُجاعِ بنِ وَهْبٍ رضِي الله عنه إلى بني هَوازِنَ .
details: كانت بنو هَوازِنَ قد مَدَّتْ يدَ المَعونَةِ لأعداءِ المسلمين مِرارًا, فأَرسلَ إليهم رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم شُجاعَ بنَ وَهْبٍ الأَسديَّ في خمسةٍ وعشرين رجلًا، وهم بالسِّيِّ, ناحيةَ رُكْبَةَ, مِن وراءِ المَعدِن, وهي مِنَ المدينةِ على خمسِ ليالٍ، وأَمرهُ أن يُغِيرَ عليهم, فكان يَسيرُ اللَّيلَ ويكَمُنُ النَّهارَ, حتَّى صَبَّحَهُم وهُم غارون، وقد أَوعزَ إلى أصحابِه ألَّا يُمْعِنوا في الطَّلَبِ، فأصابوا نَعَمًا كَثيرًا وشاءً, ولم يَلقوا كَيْداً, واسْتاقوا ذلك حتَّى قَدِموا المدينةَ, واقْتسَموا الغَنيمةَ, فكانت سهمانهم خمسةَ عشرَ بَعيرًا لِكُلِّ رَجلٍ, وعَدلوا البَعيرَ بِعشرٍ مِنَ الغَنَمِ، وكان مَغيبُهم خمسَ عشرةَ ليلةً.

title: غَزوةُ مُؤْتَةَ .
details: بعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم سَرِيَّةً في ثلاثةِ آلافِ مُقاتلٍ على الجيشِ زيدُ بنُ حارثةَ، فإن أُصيبَ فجَعفرُ بنُ أبي طالبٍ، فإنْ أُصيبَ فعبدُ اللهِ بنُ رَواحةَ، وشَيَّعهُم رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم ووَدَّعهُم، ثمَّ انْصرَف ونهَضوا، فلمَّا بلغوا مَعانَ مِن أرضِ الشَّامِ، أَتاهُم الخبرُ: أنَّ هِرقلَ مَلِكَ الرُّومِ قد نزل أرضَ بني مآبٍ، -أرضَ البَلقاءِ- في مائةِ ألفٍ مِنَ الرُّومِ، ومائةِ ألفٍ أُخرى مِن نَصارى أهلِ الشَّامِ، فأقام المسلمون في مَعانَ لَيلتينِ، يتَشاوَرون في أمرِ اللِّقاءِ بِعَدُوِّهِم البالغِ مِائتي ألفٍ فقالوا: نَكتُب إلى رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم نُخبِرُهُ بعَددِ عَدُوِّنا، فيَأمُرنا بأَمرِهِ أو يُمِدُّنا. فقال عبدُ الله بنُ رَواحةَ: يا قومُ، إنَّ الذي تَكرَهون لَلَّتِي خَرجتُم تَطلُبون -يعني الشَّهادةَ- وما نُقاتِلُ النَّاسَ بِعدَدٍ ولا قُوَّةٍ، وما نُقاتِلُهُم إلَّا بهذا الذي أَكرَمَنا الله به، فانْطَلِقوا فهي إحدى الحُسْنَيينِ: إمَّا ظُهورٌ، وإمَّا شَهادةٌ. فَوافقَهُ الجيشُ على هذا الرَّأيِ ونهَضوا، حتَّى إذا كانوا بتُخومِ البَلقاءِ لَقوا بعضَ الجُموعِ التي مع هِرقلَ بالقُربِ مِن قريةٍ يُقالُ لها: مُؤْتَةُ. فاقتَتَلوا، فقُتِلَ زيدُ بنُ حارثةَ، فأخَذ الرَّايةَ جعفرُ بنُ أبي طالبٍ، فقاتَل حتَّى قُطِعَتْ يَمينُه، فأخَذ الرَّايةَ بِيُسْراهُ فقُطِعَتْ، فاحْتضَنَها فقُتِلَ كذلك، فأخَذ عبدُ الله بنُ رَواحةَ الرَّايةَ، وتَرَدَّدَ عنِ النُّزولِ بعضَ التَّرَدُّدِ، ثمَّ صَمَّمَ، فقاتَل حتَّى قُتِلَ، فأخَذ الرَّايةَ ثابتُ بنُ أَقرمَ، وقال: يا مَعشرَ المسلمين، اصْطَلِحوا على رجلٍ منكم. فقالوا: أنت. قال: لا. فاصطَلَح النَّاسُ على خالدِ بنِ الوليدِ، فلمَّا أخَذ الرَّايةَ دافَع القَومَ وحاشى بهِم، ثمَّ انْحازَ وانْحِيزَ عنه، حتَّى انْصرَف بالنَّاسِ، فتَمَكَّنَ مِنَ الانْسِحابِ بمَن معه مِنَ المسلمين، قال خالدُ بنُ الوليدِ: لقد انقْطَعَتْ في يَدي يومَ مُؤْتَةَ تِسعةُ أَسيافٍ فما بَقِيَ في يَدي إلَّا صَفيحةٌ يَمانِيَّةٌ». وهذا يقتضي أنَّهم أثْخَنوا فيهم قَتْلًا، ولو لم يكن كذلك لَما قَدَروا على التَّخَلُّصِ منهم، ولهذا السَّببِ ولِغيرِهِ ذهَب بعضُ المُحقِّقين إلى أنَّ المسلمين قد انتصروا في هذه المعركةِ ولم يُهزَموا. عن أنسٍ رضي الله عنه: أنَّ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم، نَعَى زيدًا، وجعفرًا، وابنَ رَواحةَ للنَّاسِ، قبلَ أن يَأتِيَهُم خَبرُهُم، فقال: «أخَذ الرَّايةَ زيدٌ فأُصيبَ، ثمَّ أخَذ جعفرٌ فأُصيبَ، ثمَّ أخَذ ابنُ رَواحةَ فأُصيبَ، وعَيناهُ تَذْرِفانِ حتَّى أخَذ سيفٌ مِن سُيوفِ الله حتَّى فتَح الله عليهم».

title: غَزوةُ ذاتِ السَّلاسِلِ .
details: كانت بعدَ غزوة مُؤْتَةَ، وسُمِّيتْ ذاتَ السَّلاسِلِ لأنَّها وقعت بالقُرْبِ مِن ماءٍ يُقالُ له: السَّلْسَلُ. بلَغ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أنَّ جمعًا مِن قُضاعةَ تَجَمَّعوا وأَرادوا أن يَدنوا مِن أَطرافِ المدينةِ فَدعا النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم عَمرَو بنَ العاصِ فعقَد له لِواءً أَبيضًا وبَعثَهُ في ثلاثمائةٍ مِن سَراةِ المُهاجرين والأنصارِ، فكان أَميرُها عَمرَو بنَ العاصِ رضي الله عنه. قال عَمرٌو: بعَث إليَّ رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فقال: خُذْ عليك ثِيابَك وسِلاحَك ثمَّ ائْتِني. فأَتيتُه وهو يتَوضَّأُ، فصَعَّد فِيَّ النَّظرَ، ثمَّ طَأْطَأَ، فقال: إنِّي أُريدُ أن أَبعثَكَ على جَيشٍ، فيُسَلِّمَك الله ويُغْنِمَك، وأَرْغَبُ لك مِنَ المالِ رَغبةً صالِحةً، قال: قلتُ: يا رسولَ الله، ما أَسلمتُ مِن أجلِ المالِ، ولكنِّي أَسلمتُ رَغبةً في الإسلامِ، وأن أكونَ مع رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فقال: يا عَمرُو، نِعْمَ المالُ الصَّالحُ للمَرءِ الصَّالحِ ). وفي الغَزوةِ سأَلهُ أصحابُه أن يُوقِدوا نارًا فمَنعَهُم فكَلَّموا أبا بكرٍ فكَلَّمهُ في ذلك فقال: لا يُوقِدُ أحدٌ منهم نارًا إلَّا قَذفْتُه فيها. قال: فلَقوا العَدُوَّ فهَزموهُم فأرادوا أن يَتَبَعوهُم فمنَعهُم، فلمَّا انصرَف ذلك الجيشُ ذَكَروا للنَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وشَكَوْهُ إليه، فقال: يا رسولَ الله، إنِّي كَرِهتُ أن آذنَ لهم أن يُوقِدوا نارًا فيَرى عَدُوُّهم قِلَّتَهُم، وكَرِهتُ أن يَتْبَعُوهم فيكونُ لهم مَدَدٌ فيَعْطِفوا عليهم. فحمِد رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم أَمْرَهُ...). وفيها صلَّى عَمرٌو بالنَّاسِ وهو جُنُبٌ ومعه ماءٌ، لم يَزِدْ على أن غسَل فَرْجَهُ وتَيمَّمَ، فلمَّا قَدِمَ عَمرٌو على رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم سأَلهُ عن صلاتِه، فأَخبرَهُ فقال: والذي بعثَك بالحقِّ لو اغْتسَلتُ لَمُتُّ، لم أَجِدْ بَردًا قَطُّ مِثلَهُ، وقد قال الله عزَّ وجلَّ: {وَلَا تَقْتُلُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ بِكُمْ رَحِيمًا} [النساء: 29]، فضَحِك رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، ولم يَقُلْ له شيئًا.

title: سَرِيَّةُ أبي عُبيدةَ بنِ الجَرَّاحِ رضِي الله عنه إلى سِيفِ البَحرِ .
details: بعَث رسولُ اللّه صلَّى اللّه عليه وسلَّم أبا عُبيدةَ بنَ الجَرَّاحِ على رأسِ ثلاثمائةِ رجلٍ إلى سِيفِ البَحرِ, وكان الغَرَضُ مِن هذه السَّرِيَّةِ رَصْدَ عِيرٍ لقُريشٍ، ومُحارَبةَ حَيٍّ مِن جُهينةَ, وزَوَّدَهُم جِرابًا مِن تمرٍ, فجعل أبو عُبيدةَ يَقُوتُهُم إيَّاهُ, حتَّى صار إلى أن يَعُدَّهُ لهم عددًا, حتَّى كان يُعطي كُلَّ رجلٍ منهم كُلَّ يومٍ تمرةً, فقَسَمَها يومًا فنَقصَتْ تمرةٌ عن رجلٍ, فوَجَد فَقْدَها ذلك اليومَ, فلمَّا نَفَدَ ما كان معهم مِنَ الزَّادِ أَكلوا الخَبَطَ وهو وَرَقُ السَّلِمِ, فسُمِّيَ الجيشُ لذلك "جيشَ الخَبَطِ"، وأصابَهُم جوعٌ شَديدٌ, فنَحَرَ قيسُ بنُ سعدِ بنِ عُبادةَ -وكان أحدَ جُنودِ هذه السَّرِيَّةِ- ثلاثَ جَزائِرَ، ثمَّ نَحَرَ ثلاثَ جَزائِرَ، ثمَّ نَحَرَ ثلاثَ جَزائِرَ، ثمَّ إنَّ أبا عُبيدةَ نَهاهُ، فأَلقى إليهم البَحرُ دابَّةً يُقالُ لها: العَنْبَرُ، فأكلوا منها عِشرين ليلةً، وادَّهَنوا منه, حتَّى ثابَتْ منه أَجسامُهم، وصَلحتْ، وأخَذ أبو عُبيدةَ ضِلعًا مِن أَضلاعِه فنظَر إلى أَطولِ رجلٍ في الجيشِ وأَطولِ جَملٍ فحُمِلَ عليه ومَرَّ تَحتَهُ، وتَزوَّدوا مِن لَحمِه وَشَائِقَ، فلمَّا قَدِموا المدينةَ، أَتَوْا رسولَ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فذَكَروا له ذلك، فقال: "هو رِزقٌ أَخرَجهُ الله لكم، فهل معكم مِن لَحمِه شيءٌ تُطْعِمونا؟). فأَرسلوا إلى رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم منه فأَكلَهُ".

title: سَرِيَّةُ أبي قَتادةَ الأَنصاريِّ إلى خَضِرَة .
details: بعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أبا قَتادةَ بنَ رِبْعِيٍّ رضي الله عنه في سَرِيَّةٍ إلى خَضِرَة؛ وذلك لأنَّ بني غَطَفَانَ كانوا يَحْتَشِدون في خَضِرَة -وهي أرضُ مُحَارِبٍ بِنَجْدٍ- فبعَثهُ صلى الله عليه وسلم في خمسةَ عشرَ رجلًا، فقَتَلَ منهم، وسَبَى وغَنِمَ، وكانت غَيبتُه خمسَ عشرةَ ليلةً.

title: سَرِيَّةُ أبي قَتادةَ رضِي الله عنه إلى بَطْنِ إِضَمٍ .
details: لمَّا نَقضَتْ قُريشٌ ومَن معها العهدَ الذين الذي بينهم وبين المسلمين في الحُديبيةِ عزَم رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم على المَسيرِ إليهم، أمَر النَّاسَ بالجِهازِ وأَعلمَهُم أنَّه سائِرٌ لمكَّةَ، وقال: (اللَّهمَّ خُذِ العُيونَ والأَخبارَ عن قُريشٍ حتَّى نَبْغَتَها في بِلادِها). وزِيادةٌ في الإخفاءِ والتَّعمِيَةِ بعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم سَرِيَّةً قَوامُها ثَمانيةُ رِجالٍ، تحت قِيادةِ أبي قَتادةَ بنِ رِبْعِيٍّ، إلى بَطْنِ إِضَمٍ، فيما بين ذي خَشَبٍ وذي المَروَةِ، على ثلاثةِ بُرُدٍ مِنَ المدينةِ، في أوَّلِ هذا الشَّهرِ الكريمِ؛ لِيَظُنَّ الظَّانُ أنَّه صلى الله عليه وسلم يتَوَجَّهُ إلى تلك النَّاحيةِ، ولِتذهَبَ بذلك الأَخبارُ، وواصلت هذه السَّرِيَّةُ سَيْرَها حتَّى إذا وصلت حيثما أُمِرَتْ بلَغها أنَّ رسولَ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم خرَج إلى مكَّةَ، فسارت إليه حتَّى لَحِقْتُه.

title: غَزوةُ فَتحِ مكَّةَ .
details: كان سببُها أنَّ المشركين نقَضوا العهدَ الذي بينهم وبين رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فأَغاروا على إحدى القَبائلِ المُحالفةِ للرَّسولِ عليه الصَّلاةُ والسَّلامُ، وهي قَبيلةُ خُزاعةَ، ولمَّا عَلِمَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بالأَمرِ أَمَرَ النَّاسَ بالتَّجَهُّزِ دون أن يُخبِرَهُم بوِجْهَتِه، ثمَّ مضى حتَّى نزَل بمَرِّ الظَّهرانِ وهو وادٍ قَريبٌ مِن مكَّةَ. فعنِ ابنِ عبَّاسٍ رضِي الله عنهما: أنَّ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم خرَج في رَمضانَ مِنَ المدينةِ ومعه عشرةُ آلافٍ، وذلك على رأسِ ثمانِ سِنين ونِصفٍ مِن مَقْدَمِه المدينةَ، فسار هو ومَن معه مِنَ المسلمين إلى مكَّةَ، يَصومُ ويَصومون، حتَّى بلَغ الكَدِيدَ، وهو ماءٌ بين عُسْفانَ، وقُدَيْدٍ أَفطَر وأَفطَروا. وكان أبو سُفيانَ قد رَأى جيشَ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم قبلَ دُخولِه مكَّةَ، فهالَهُ ما رَأى، ثمَّ أَسلَم في أثناءِ ذلك، ثمَّ جاء إلى قومِه وصرَخ فيهم مُحذِّرًا لهم بأن لا قِبَلَ لهم بِجيشِ محمَّدٍ صلى الله عليه وسلم، وقال لهم ما قاله عليه الصَّلاةُ والسَّلامُ: مَن دخَل دارَ أبي سُفيانَ فهو آمِن، ومَن أَغلَق عليه دارَهُ فهو آمِن، ومَن دخَل المسجِدَ فهو آمِن. فتَفرَّقَ النَّاسُ إلى دورِهِم وإلى المسجِدِ. وعن عائشةَ رضي الله عنها: أنَّ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم دخَل عامَ الفتحِ مِن كَداءٍ التي بأعلى مكَّةَ. وقد أَهدَر النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم دَمَ بعضِ المشركين يومَ الفتحِ، ووجَد عليه الصَّلاةُ والسَّلامُ حولَ البيتِ ثلاثمائةٍ وسِتِّين نُصُبًا، فجعل يَطعنُها بِعودٍ في يَدِه ويقولُ: (جاء الحقُّ وزَهَقَ الباطلُ، جاء الحقُّ، وما يُبْدِئُ الباطلُ وما يُعيدُ). وقد تَفاوَتت الرِّواياتُ في مُدَّةِ إقامتِه صلى الله عليه وسلم عامَ الفتحِ، و الأرجحُ -والله أعلم- أنَّها كانت تِسعةَ عشرَ يومًا.

title: سَرِيَّةُ خالدِ بنِ الوليدِ رضِي الله عنه إلى العُزَّى بنَخْلَةَ .
details: لمَّا اطْمأَنَّ رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بعدَ الفتحِ بعَث خالدَ بنَ الوليدِ إلى العُزَّى لخمسِ ليالٍ بَقِينَ مِن هذا الشَّهرِ الكريمِ لِيَهدِمَها، وكانت بِنَخْلَةَ، وكانت لقُريشٍ وجميعِ بني كِنانةَ, وهي أَعظمُ أَصنامِهم. وكان سَدَنَتُها بني شَيبانَ؛ فخرَج إليها خالدٌ في ثلاثين فارسًا حتَّى انتهى إليها فهَدمَها. ولمَّا رجَع إليها سألهُ رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم (هل رأيتَ شيئًا؟). قال: لا. قال: (فإنَّك لم تَهدِمْها فارجِعْ إليها فاهْدِمْها). فرجع خالدٌ مُتَغَيِّظًا قد جَرَّدَ سَيفَهُ فخَرجتْ إليه امرأةٌ عُريانةٌ سَوداءُ ناشِرَةُ الرَّأسِ، فجعَل السَّادِنُ يَصيحُ بها، فضربها خالدٌ فجزَلها بِاثْنتَينِ، ثمَّ رجَع إلى رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فأخبرَهُ، فقال: (نعم، تلك العُزَّى، وقد أَيِسَتْ أن تُعْبَدَ في بلادِكُم أبدًا).

title: سَرِيَّةُ عَمرِو بنِ العاصِ رضِي الله عنه إلى سُواعٍ، صَنَمِ هُذيلٍ .
details: بعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم عَمرَو بنَ العاصِ إلى سُواعٍ لِيَهدِمَهُ، وسُواعٌ صَنَمٌ لقومِ نوحٍ عليه السَّلامُ، ثمَّ صار بعدَ ذلك لقَبيلةِ هُذيلٍ المُضَريَّةِ, وظَلَّ هذا الوَثَنُ مَنصوبًا تَعبُدهُ هُذيلٌ وتُعَظِّمُهُ, حتَّى إنَّهم كانوا يَحُجُّون إليه حتَّى فُتِحَتْ مكَّةُ ودخلَت هُذيلٌ فيمَن دخَل في دينِ الله أفواجًا، وكان مَوضعُه بِرُهاطٍ على قُرابةِ 150 كيلو مترًا شمالَ شرقيِّ مكَّةَ، فلمَّا انتهى إليه عَمرٌو قال له السَّادِنُ: ما تُريدُ؟ قال: أمَرني رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم أن أَهدِمَهُ. قال: لا تَقدِرُ على ذلك. قال: لِمَ ؟ قال تُمْنَعُ. قال: حتَّى الآنَ أنت على الباطلِ؟ وَيْحَكَ فهل يَسمعُ أو يُبصِرُ؟ ثم دَنا فكسَرهُ، وأمَر أصحابَهُ فهدموا بيتَ خَزانَتِهِ فلم يَجِدوا فيه شيئًا، ثمَّ قال للسَّادِنِ: كيف رأيتَ؟ قال: أَسلمتُ لله.

title: سَرِيَّةُ خالدِ بنِ الوليدِ رضِي الله عنه إلى بني جَذِيمَةَ .
details: لمَّا رجَع خالدُ بنُ الوليدِ مِن هَدْمِ العُزَّى بعَثهُ رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى بني جَذيمَةَ داعِيًا إلى الإسلامِ لا مُقاتِلًا, فخرَج في ثلاثمائةٍ وخمسين رجلًا مِنَ المُهاجرين والأنصارِ وبني سُليمٍ، فانتهى إليهم فدَعاهُم إلى الإسلامِ فلم يُحسِنوا أن يَقولوا: أَسلَمْنا، فجعلوا يَقولون: صَبَأْنا، صَبَأْنا. -فحملها خالد على أنها سُخرية بالإسلام لأن قريشًا كانت تقول لمن أسلم صبأ تعييرا له- فجعَل خالدٌ يَقتُلُهم ويَأْسِرُهُم, ودفَع إلى كُلِّ رجلٍ ممَّن كان معه أَسِيرًا، فأمَر يومًا أن يَقتُلَ كُلُّ رجلٍ أَسِيرَهُ, فأبى ابنُ عُمَرَ وأصحابُه حتَّى قَدِموا على النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فذكَروا له، فرفَع صلى الله عليه وسلم يَديهِ وقال: (اللَّهمَّ إنِّي أَبْرَأُ إليك ممَّا صنَع خالدٌ ) مَرَّتين. وكانت بنو سُليمٍ هُم الذين قَتَلوا أَسْراهُم دون المُهاجرين والأنصارِ, وبعَث رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم علِيًّا, فَوَدَى لهم قَتلاهُم وما ذهَب منهم.

title: غزوة الطَّائفِ بعد أن حاصرها المسلمون أربعين ليلة .
details: بعدَ أن تَعقَّبَ المسلمون فُلولَ الهارِبين مِن هَوازِنَ في أَوْطاسٍ ونَخْلةَ، تَوجَّهوا للقَضاءِ على ثَقيفٍ التي فَرَّتْ مِن حُنينٍ وأَوْطاسٍ، وتَحصَّنتْ بحُصونِها المَنيعَةِ في الطَّائفِ، وفي صَحيحِ مُسلمٍ: أنَّ الرَّسولَ صلى الله عليه وسلم ومَن معه مِنَ المسلمين حاصروا المشركين في الطَّائفِ أربعين ليلةً. عن أبي نَجيحٍ السُّلميِّ قال: حاصَرْنا مع نَبيِّ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم حِصْنَ الطَّائفِ فسمعتُ رسولَ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم يقولُ: مَن بلَغ بِسَهْمٍ فَلهُ دَرجةٌ في الجنَّةِ. قال: فبلَغتُ يَومئذٍ سِتَّةَ عشرَ سَهْمًا.....). وقد هرَب مِن ذلك الحِصنِ إلى رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم ثلاثةٌ وعشرون رجلًا، عن عبدِ الله بنِ عُمَرَ، قال: لمَّا حاصَر رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم الطَّائفَ، فلم يَنَلْ منهم شيئًا قال: «إنَّا قافِلون إن شاء الله. فثَقُلَ عليهم، وقالوا: نَذهبُ ولا نَفتَحُه. فقال: «اغْدوا على القِتالِ». فغَدَوْا فأَصابَهم جِراحٌ، فقال: «إنَّا قافِلون غَدًا إن شاء الله». فأَعجبَهُم، فضَحِكَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم.

title: غَزوةُ حُنينٍ (هَوازِنَ) .
details: حُنينُ: وادٍ إلى جَنبِ ذي المَجازِ، قريبٌ مِنَ الطَّائفِ، وبينه وبين مكَّةَ بضعةَ عشرَ مِيلًا مِن جِهَةِ الشرائع والسيل الكبير، وقِيلَ سُمِّيَ بِحُنَيْنٍ؛ نِسبَةً إلى رَجلٍ يُدعَى: حُنينَ بنَ قابِثَةَ بنِ مَهْلائِيلَ. وكان النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم قد أقامَ بمكَّةَ 19 يومًا، حتَّى جاءَتْ هَوازِنُ وثَقيفٌ فنزلوا بحُنينٍ يُريدون قِتالَ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم، وكانوا قد جمَعوا قبلَ ذلك حين سَمِعوا بمَخرجِ رسولِ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم مِنَ المدينةِ، وهُم يَظنُّون أنَّه إنَّما يُريدُهم، فلمَّا أَتاهُم أنَّه قد نزَل مكَّةَ، أخَذوا في الاسْتِعدادِ لِمُواجهَتِه، وقد أَرادوها مَوقِعَةً حاسِمةً، فحَشدوا الأموالَ والنِّساءَ والأَبناءَ حتَّى لا يَفِرَّ أَحدُهم ويَترك أهلَهُ ومالَهُ، وكان يَقودُهم مالكُ بنُ عَوفٍ النَّضْريُّ، واسْتنفَروا معهم غَطَفانَ وغيرَها. فاسْتعَدَّ الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم لِمُواجَهتِهم، فاسْتَعارَ مِن يَعْلى بنِ أُميَّةَ ثلاثين بَعيرًا وثلاثين دِرْعًا، واسْتَعارَ مِن صَفوانَ بنِ أُميَّةَ مائةَ دِرْعٍ، واسْتعمَل عَتَّابَ بنَ أَسِيدِ بنِ أبي العاصِ أَميرًا على مكَّةَ، وقد ثبَت في الصَّحيحين أنَّ الطُّلقاءَ قد خرَجوا معه إلى حُنينٍ. واسْتقبَل الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم بجَيشِه وادِيَ حُنينٍ في عَمايَةِ الصُّبْحِ، وانْحَدروا فيه، وعند دُخولِهم إلى الوادي حَملوا على هَوازِنَ فانْكشَفوا، فأَكَبَّ المسلمون على ما تَركوهُ مِن غَنائِمَ، وبينما هُم على هذه الحالِ اسْتقبَلَتْهُم هَوازِنُ وأَمطَرتْهُم بِوابِلٍ مِنَ السِّهامِ، ولم يكنْ المسلمون يَتوقَّعون هذا فضاقَتْ عليهم الأَرضُ بما رَحُبَتْ، فوَلَّوْا مُدْبِرين لا يَلْوِي أحدٌ على أحدٍ، وانْحازَ الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم ذاتَ اليَمينِ وهو يقولُ: (أين النَّاسُ؟ هَلُمُّوا إليَّ، أنا رسولُ الله، أنا رسولُ الله، أنا محمَّدُ بنُ عبدِ الله). وأمَر الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم عَمَّهُ العبَّاسَ -وكان جَهْوَرِيَّ الصَّوتِ- أن يُنادِيَ النَّاسَ بالثَّباتِ، وخَصَّ منهم أصحابَ بَيعةِ الرِّضوانِ، فأَسرَعوا إليه، ثمَّ خَصَّ الأَنصارَ بالنِّداءِ، ثمَّ بني الحارثِ بنِ الخَزرجِ، فطاروا إليه قائِلِين: لَبَّيْكَ، لَبَّيْكَ. ودارت المَعركةُ قَويَّةً ضِدَّ هَوازِنَ، وقال الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم عندما رأى المَعركةَ تَشْتَدُّ: (هذا حين حَمِيَ الوَطيسُ). ثمَّ أخَذ حَصَياتٍ -أو تُرابا- فرَمى به وُجوهِ الكُفَّارِ وهو يقولُ: (شاهَتِ الوُجوهُ). فما خلَق الله تعالى منهم إنسانًا إلَّا مَلأَ عَينَيْهِ تُرابًا بتلك القَبضةِ، فوَلَّوْا مُدْبِرين، والرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم يقولُ: (انْهزَموا ورَبِّ محمَّدٍ)، وفي رِوايةٍ أُخرى: (انْهزَموا ورَبِّ الكَعبةِ, انْهزَموا ورَبِّ الكَعبةِ). وقد رُوِيَ: أنَّ قَتْلى بني مالكٍ مِن ثَقيفٍ لِوَحدِها قد بلَغ 70 قَتيلًا، وقُتِلَ بأَوْطاسٍ مِن بني مالكٍ 300، وقُتِلَ خُلَقٌ كَثيرٌ مِن بني نَصرِ بنِ مُعاوِيَةَ ثمَّ مِن بني رِئابٍ، ورُوِيَ: أنَّ سَبْيَ حُنينٍ قد بلَغ 6000 مِنَ النِّساءِ والأَبناءِ. بينما قُتِلَ مِنَ المسلمين أربعةٌ.

title: عُمرَةُ الجِعْرانَةِ .
details: ثبَت أنَّ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم اعْتمَرَ مِنَ الجِعْرانةِ عامَ حُنينٍ، وهذه العُمرَةُ هي الثَّالثةُ بعدَ عُمرَةِ الحُديبيَةِ وعُمرَةِ القَضاءِ. قال ابنُ حَجَرٍ: فإنَّه صلى الله عليه وسلم أَحرَمَ مِنَ الجِعْرانةِ ودخَل مكَّةَ ليلًا فقَضى أمْرَ العُمرَةِ ثمَّ رجَع ليلًا فأَصبحَ بالجِعْرانةِ كَبائِتٍ. قال إبراهيمُ النَّخَعيُّ: كانوا يَستَحِبُّون أن يَدخلوا مكَّةَ نهارًا ويَخرُجوا منها ليلًا. وعن عطاءٍ: إن شِئْتُم فادْخُلوا ليلًا إنَّكم لَستُم كرسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، إنَّه كان إمامًا فأَحَبَّ أن يَدخُلَها نهارًا لِيَراهُ النَّاسُ. انتهى. وقَضيَّةُ هذا أنَّ مَن كان إمامًا يُقْتَدى به اسْتُحِبَ له أن يَدخُلَها نهارًا.

title: وَفاةُ أمِّ كُلثومٍ بنتِ رسولِ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم .
details: هي أمُّ كُلثومٍ بنتُ رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم- البَضْعَةُ الرَّابعةُ النَّبَوِيَّةُ، أمُّها خَديجةُ بنتُ خُويلدٍ رضي الله عنها، يُقالُ تَزوَّجها عُتَيْبةُ بنُ أبي لَهبٍ ثمَّ فارَقَها، وأَسلَمتْ وهاجَرتْ بعدَ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم، فلمَّا تُوفِّيتْ أُختُها رُقيَّةُ تزَوَّجَ بها عُثمانُ في رَبيعٍ الأوَّلِ سَنةَ ثلاثٍ فلم تَلِدْ له.

title: عامُ الوُفودِ .
details: كان مِن أَبرَزِ نَتائجِ فَتحِ مكَّةَ أن أَخذتْ قَبائلُ العربِ وأَفرادُها يُبادِرون بإسلامِهم؛ لأنَّهم كانوا يَنتظِرون نَتيجةَ الصِّراعِ بين المسلمين وقُريشٍ، فعن عَمرِو بنِ سَلمةَ قال: كُنَّا بماءٍ مَمَرَّ النَّاسِ، وكان يَمُرُّ بِنا الرُّكبانُ فنسألُهم: ما للنَّاسِ، ما للنَّاسِ؟ ما هذا الرَّجلُ؟ فيقولون: يَزعُم أنَّ الله أَرسلَهُ، أَوْحى إليه -أو: أَوْحى الله بكذا- فكنتُ أَحفظُ ذلك الكلامَ، وكأنَّما يُقَرُّ في صدري، وكانتِ العربُ تَلَوَّمُ بإسلامِهم الفَتحَ، فيَقولون: اتْرُكوهُ وقَومَهُ، فإنَّه إن ظهَر عليهم فهو نَبِيٌّ صادِقٌ. فلمَّا كانت وَقعةُ أهلِ الفَتحِ بادَر كُلُّ قومٍ بإسلامِهم، وبَدَرَ أبي قومي بإسلامِهم.

title: نزول فريضة الحج .
details: كان الحَجُّ مَعروفًا قبلَ البعثة، فإبراهيمُ أَذَّنَ في النَّاسِ بالحَجِّ، وحَجَّ موسى وغيرُه مِنَ الأنبياءِ، وبَقِيَ الحَجُّ مَعروفًا ولكن بَدَّلَ فيه المُشركون ما بَدَّلوا، وأَوَّلُ مَن بَدَّلَ عَمرُو بنُ لُحَيٍّ، ثمَّ فرَض الله تعالى الحَجَّ على المسلمين لِمَن اسْتَطاع إليه سَبيلًا، {وَلِلَّهِ عَلَى النَّاسِ حِجُّ الْبَيْتِ مَنِ اسْتَطَاعَ إِلَيْهِ سَبِيلًا} [آل عمران: 97]، وبَيَّن الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم مَناسِكَهُ بِتَمامِها في حَجَّةِ الوَداعِ في سَنَةِ 10هـ، واخْتُلِف في أيِّ عامٍ فُرِضَ الحَجُّ، قِيلَ: فُرِضَ في سَنَةِ سِتٍّ. وقِيلَ: سَنَةَ سبعٍ. وقِيلَ: سَنَةَ ثَمانٍ. وقِيلَ غيرَ ذلك.

title: وَفاةُ النَّجاشِيِّ صاحِبِ الحَبشةِ رضِي الله عنه .
details: هو أَصْحَمَةُ بنُ أَبْجَرَ مَلِكُ الحَبشةِ، والنَّجاشيُّ لَقبٌ له ولمُلوكِ الحَبشةِ، ومَعْنى: أَصْحَمَةَ: عَطِيَّةُ، وقِيلَ: عَطِيَّةُ الله، وقِيلَ: عَطاءٌ. تَوَلَّى الحُكمَ بعدَ مَوتِ عَمِّهِ، وبعدَ سَنواتٍ مِن حُكمِهِ وانْتِشارِ عَدْلِه أَسلمَ في عَهدِ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم، وأَحسنَ إلى المسلمين الذين هاجَروا إلى أَرضِه، قال رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم لأَصحابِه عن النَّجاشيِّ: لو خَرجتُم إلى أرضِ الحَبشةِ فإنَّ بها مَلِكًا لا يُظْلَمُ عنده أحدٌ، وهي أرضُ صِدْقٍ، حتَّى يَجعلَ الله لكم فَرَجًا. ولمَّا ماتَ صلَّى عليه النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بالمدينةِ صَلاةَ الغائِبِ، فعن أبي هُريرةَ رضي الله عنه: أنَّ رسولَ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم نَعى لهم النَّجاشيَّ صاحِبَ الحَبشةِ، في اليَومِ الذي مات فيه، وقال: «اسْتَغْفِروا لأَخيكُم ». وعن جابرٍ رضي الله عنه: قال النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم حين مات النَّجاشيُّ: «مات اليَومَ رَجلٌ صالِحٌ، فقوموا فصَلُّوا على أَخيكُم أَصْحَمَةَ».

title: غَزوةُ تَبوكَ وجَيشُ العُسْرَةِ .
details: تَبوكُ مَوضِعٌ بين وادي القُرى والشَّامِ، قال أبو موسى الأَشعريُّ رضي الله عنه: (أَرسلَني أَصحابي إلى رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أَسأَلُه الحُمْلانَ لهم إذ هُم معه في جَيشِ العُسْرَةِ، وهي غَزوةُ تَبوكَ..). وحديث أبي موسى رضي الله عنه فيه دِلالةٌ على ما كان عليه الصَّحابةُ مِنَ العُسْرِ الشَّديدِ في المالِ والزَّادِ والرَّكائِبِ، كما رَوى مُسلمٌ أيضًا عن أبي هُريرةَ رضي الله عنه ما وقع للمسلمين في طَريقِ هذه الغَزوةِ مِن نَقْصٍ في الزَّادِ حتَّى مَصُّوا النَّوَى وشَرِبوا عليه الماءَ، وفي رِوايةٍ أُخرى لمُسلمٍ: أنَّهم اسْتأذَنوا الرَّسولَ صلى الله عليه وسلم في نَحْرِ مَطاياهُم لِيأكُلوا. وقد قال الله تعالى: {لَقَدْ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ وَالْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالْأَنْصَارِ الَّذِينَ اتَّبَعُوهُ فِي سَاعَةِ الْعُسْرَةِ} [التوبة: 117]. قال ابنُ كَثيرٍ: فعزَم رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم على قِتالِ الرُّومِ؛ لأنَّهم أَقربُ النَّاسِ إليه؛ وأَوْلى النَّاسِ بالدَّعوَةِ إلى الحقِّ لقُربِهِم إلى الإسلامِ وأَهلِه، وقد قال الله تعالى: {يَاأَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا قَاتِلُوا الَّذِينَ يَلُونَكُمْ مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ وَلْيَجِدُوا فِيكُمْ غِلْظَةً وَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الْمُتَّقِينَ} [التوبة: 123]. وقد بَيَّنَ صلى الله عليه وسلم وِجْهَةَ هذه الغَزوةِ، فعن مُعاذٍ رضي الله عنه: أنَّ رسولَ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم قال: (سَتأْتون غدًا إن شاء الله عَيْنَ تَبوكَ، وإنَّكم لن تَأْتوها حتَّى يَضْحى النَّهارُ، فمَن جاءَها مِنكم فلا يَمَسَّ مِن مائِها شيئًا حتَّى آتي). والمشهورُ والرَّاجحُ أنَّ جَيشَ تَبوكَ كان ثلاثين ألفًا، ولكنَّ الرَّسولَ صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم لم يَلْقَ حَربًا مِنَ الأعداءِ، فرجَع إلى المدينةِ مُنتصِرًا بعدَ أن أقامَ بتَبوكَ عِشرين ليلةً.

title: وَفاةُ رَأْسِ المُنافقين عبدِ الله بنِ أُبَيٍّ ابنِ سَلولَ .
details: هو عبدُ الله بنُ أُبَيٍّ بن ابنُ سَلولَ، رَأْسُ المُنافقين، مَرِضَ في ليالٍ بَقِينَ مِن شَوَّالٍ بعدَ أن رجَع رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم مِن غَزوةِ تَبوكَ, ولمَّا مات اسْتَغفَرَ له رسولُ اللّه صلى الله عليه وسلم، وصلَّى عليه بعدَ أن حاوَلَ عُمَرُ مَنْعَهُ عن الصَّلاةِ عليه، وقد نزَل القُرآنُ بعدَ ذلك بِمُوافَقَةِ عُمَرَ رضي الله عنه، وإنَّما صلَّى عليه رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم إجراءً له على حُكمِ الظَّاهرِ وهو الإسلامُ؛ ولِما فيه مِن مَصلَحةٍ شَرعيَّةٍ؛ وهو تَأليفُ قُلوبِ قَومِه وتابِعيهِ، فقد كان يَدِينُ له بالوَلاءِ فِئَةٌ كَبيرةٌ مِنَ المُنافقين، فعسى أن يَتأثَّروا ويَرجِعوا عن نِفاقِهم ويَعتبِروا ويُخلِصوا لله ولِرسولِهِ.

title: حَجَّةُ أبي بكرٍ الصِّدِّيقِ ونُزولُ سُورةِ بَراءَة .
details: بعَث النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أبا بكرٍ أَميرًا على الحَجِّ بعدَ انْسِلاخِ ذي القَعدةِ لِيُقيمَ للمسلمين حَجَّهُم -والنَّاسُ مِن أهلِ الشِّركِ على مَنازِلهم مِن حَجِّهِم- فخرَج أبو بكرٍ رضِي الله عنه ومَن معه مِنَ المسلمين، وقد بعَث عليه الصَّلاةُ والسَّلامُ عَلِيًّا رضي الله عنه بعدَ أبي بكرٍ الصِّدِّيقِ رضي الله عنه لِيكونَ معه، ويَتوَلَّى علِيٌّ بِنَفْسِه إبلاغَ البَراءةِ إلى المشركين نِيابَةً عن رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم لِكونِهِ ابنَ عَمِّهِ، مِن عَصَبَتِهِ، قال أبو هُريرةَ: بعَثَني أبو بكرٍ في تلك الحَجَّةِ في مُؤَذِّنين يَومَ النَّحْرِ، نُؤَذِّنُ بمِنًى: أن لا يَحُجَّ بعدَ العامِ مُشركٌ، ولا يَطوفَ بالبيتِ عُريانٌ. قال حُميدُ بنُ عبدِ الرَّحمنِ: ثمَّ أَردَفَ رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم عَلِيًّا، فأَمَرهُ أن يُؤَذِّنَ ببَراءَة. قال أبو هُريرةَ: فأَذَّنَ مَعَنا علِيٌّ في أهلِ مِنًى يَومَ النَّحْرِ: لا يَحُجُّ بعدَ العامِ مُشرِكٌ، ولا يَطوفُ بالبيتِ عُريانٌ.

title: تَتابُعُ الوُفودِ إلى النَّبيِّ صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم .
details: بَقِيَتِ الوُفودُ تَتابَعُ إلى رسولِ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم، وكان بينها وَفْدُ نَصارى نَجْرانَ، ومصالحتهم وصالَحَهُم على الجِزْيَةِ، وجعَل لهم ذِمَّةً.

title: وَفاةُ إبراهيمَ ابنِ النَّبيِّ صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم .
details: إبراهيمُ ابنُ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم، وأمُّهُ مارِيَةُ القِبْطِيَّةُ، وقد كان جَميعُ أَولادِ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِن خَديجةَ رضي الله عنها، ما عَدا إبراهيمَ فمِن مارِيَةَ القِبطيَّةِ المِصريَّةِ رضي الله عنها، قال أنسُ بنُ مالكٍ رضي الله عنه: «ما رَأيتُ أحدًا كان أَرحمَ بالعِيالِ مِن رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم. قال: كان إبراهيمُ مُسْتَرْضِعًا له في عَوالي المَدينةِ، فكان يَنطلِقُ ونحن معه فيَدخُلُ البيتَ وإنَّه لَيُدَخَّنُ، وكان ظِئْرُهُ قَيْنًا، فيَأخُذهُ فيُقَبِّلُهُ، ثمَّ يَرجِع. قال عَمرٌو: فلمَّا تُوفِّيَ إبراهيمُ قال رسولُ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم: «إنَّ إبراهيمَ ابْنِي، وإنَّه مات في الثَّدْيِ، وإنَّ له لَظِئْرَيْنِ تُكَمِّلانِ رَضاعَهُ في الجنَّةِ ». عن المُغيرةِ بنِ شُعبةَ قال: كَسَفتِ الشَّمسُ على عَهدِ رسولِ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم يَومَ مات إبراهيمُ، فقال النَّاسُ: كَسَفتِ الشَّمسُ لِمَوتِ إبراهيمَ. فقال رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم: «إنَّ الشَّمسَ والقَمرَ لا يَنْكَسِفانِ لِمَوتِ أَحدٍ ولا لِحَياتِه، فإذا رَأيْتُم فصَلُّوا، وادْعوا الله ». عن أبي بَكرةَ قال: خَسَفتِ الشَّمسُ على عَهدِ رسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فخرَج يَجُرُّ رِداءَهُ حتَّى انْتَهى إلى المسجدِ، وَثابَ النَّاسُ إليه، فصلَّى بهم رَكعتينِ، فانْجَلتِ الشَّمسُ، فقال: «إنَّ الشَّمسَ والقَمرَ آيتانِ مِن آياتِ الله، وإنَّهما لا يَخْسِفانِ لِمَوتِ أَحدٍ، وإذا كان ذاك فصَلُّوا وادْعوا حتَّى يُكْشَفَ ما بكم». وذاك أنَّ ابْنًا للنَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مات يُقالُ له: إبراهيمُ. فقال النَّاسُ في ذاك. وُلِدَ له إبراهيمُ بالمدينةِ مِن سُرِّيَّتِهِ مارِيَةَ القِبطيَّةِ، سَنَةَ ثَمانٍ مِن الهِجرةِ، وبَشَّرَهُ به أبو رافعٍ مَولاهُ، فوَهَبَ له عَبدًا، ومات طِفلًا قَبلَ الفِطامِ، واخْتُلِف هل صلَّى عليه أم لا؟ على قَولين.

title: حَجَّةُ الوَداعِ وتسمى حَجَّةُ الإسلامِ أو حَجَّةُ البَلاغِ .
details: سُمِّيَتْ حَجَّةَ الوَداعِ؛ لأنَّه عليه الصَّلاةُ والسَّلامُ وَدَّعَ النَّاسَ فيها، ولم يَحُجَّ بعدَها، وسُمِّيَتْ حَجَّةَ الإسلامِ؛ لأنَّه عليه السَّلامُ لم يَحُجَّ مِنَ المدينةِ غيرَها، وسُمِّيَتْ حَجَّةَ البَلاغِ؛ لأنَّه عليه السَّلامُ بلَّغَ النَّاسَ شَرْعَ الله في الحَجِّ قَولًا وفِعلًا، ولم يكنْ بَقِيَ مِن دَعائِمِ الإسلامِ وقَواعِدِهِ شيءٌ إلَّا وقد بيَّنَهُ عليه السَّلامُ، فلمَّا بيَّنَ لهم شَريعَةَ الحَجِّ ووَضَّحَهُ وشَرحَهُ أَنزلَ الله عزَّ وجلَّ عليه وهو واقِفٌ بِعَرفةَ: {الْيَوْمَ أَكْمَلْتُ لَكُمْ دِينَكُمْ وَأَتْمَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعْمَتِي وَرَضِيتُ لَكُمُ الْإِسْلَامَ دِينًا} [المائدة: 3]. وعندما أَعلنَ الرَّسولُ صلى الله عليه وسلم عَزمَهُ على الحَجِّ في هذا العامِ قَدِمَ المدينةَ بَشَرٌ كَثيرٌ، كُلُّهُم يَلتَمِسُ أن يَأْتَمَّ بِرسولِ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، ويَعملَ مِثلَ عَملِهِ. وخرَج مِنَ المدينةِ لِخمسٍ بَقِينَ مِن ذي القَعدةِ. وقد وقعَت للنَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم في مَسيرِهِ هذا ورُجوعِهِ أَحداثٌ كَثيرةٌ.

title: مُصيبَةُ المسلمين الكُبرى بِوَفاةِ رسولِ الله صلَّى الله عليه وسلَّم .
details: اشْتَكى رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بعدَ عَودتِه مِن حَجَّةِ الوَداعِ، حتَّى اشْتَدَّ وَجَعُهُ وهو في بيت مَيمونَةَ رضي الله عنها، فدَعا نِساءَهُ فاسْتأذَنَهُنَّ في أن يُمَرَّضَ في بيتِ عائشةَ رضي الله عنها، قالت عائشةُ رضي الله عنها: كان النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يقولُ في مَرضِهِ الذي مات فيه: «يا عائشةُ ما أَزالُ أَجِدُ أَلَمَ الطَّعامِ الذي أَكلتُ بِخَيبرَ، فهذا أَوانُ وَجَدْتُ انْقِطاعَ أَبْهَري مِن ذلك السُّمِّ ». واسْتغرَقَ مَرضُهُ عشرةَ أيَّامٍ، قال ابنُ حَجَرٍ: (واخْتُلِفَ في مُدَّةِ مَرضِه، فالأكثرُ على أنَّها ثلاثةَ عشرَ يومًا، وقِيلَ بزيادةِ يَومٍ، وقِيلَ بِنَقصِه، وقِيلَ: عشرةُ أيَّامٍ. وبه جزَم سُليمانُ التَّيميُّ في مَغازيهِ، وأَخرَجهُ البَيهقيُّ بإسنادٍ صَحيحٍ). ثمَّ تَوفَّاهُ الله تعالى يَومَ الاثنين في الثَّاني عشر من رَبيعٍ الأوَّلِ، وقد تَمَّ له مِنَ العُمُرِ 63 سَنَةً، وكُفِّنَ عليه الصَّلاةُ والسَّلامُ في ثلاثةِ أَثوابٍ بِيضٍ سَحُولِيَّةٍ مِن كُرْسُفٍ، ليس فيها قَميصٌ ولا عِمامَةٌ، وصلَّى النَّاسُ عليه أَرْسالًا، ودُفِنَ في مكانِ مَوتِهِ في حُجرَةِ عائشةَ رضي الله عنها، وجَزاهُ الله تعالى عن المسلمين خيرَ ما جَزَى نَبِيًّا عن أُمَّتِهِ.

title: خروج الأسود العنسي في اليمن وقتله على يد فيروز الديلمي .
details: خرج الأسوَدُ العَنْسيُّ -واسمُه عَبهلةُ بنُ كَعبِ بنِ غَوثٍ- في آخِرِ حياةِ رَسولِ اللهِ صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم في سَبْعِمائةِ مقاتلٍ، فكَتَب إلى عمَّالِ النَّبيِّ صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم: أيُّها المتمَرِّدون علينا، أمسِكوا علينا ما أخَذْتُم مِن أرضِنا، ووفِّروا ما جمعتُم؛ فنحن أَولى به، وأنتم على ما أنتم عليه، ثمَّ توجَّه مع مقاتِلِيه إلى نجرانَ فأخَذَها، ثمَّ قَصَد صنعاءَ، فخرج إليه شَهرُ بنُ باذامَ فتقاتلا، فغَلَبه الأسوَدُ وقتَلَه وتزوَّج بامرأةِ شَهرِ بنِ باذامَ، وهي ابنةُ عَمِّ فيروز الدَّيلميِّ، واسمُه آزاذُ، وكانت مؤمنةً باللهِ ورَسولِه صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم، ومِن الصَّالحاتِ، واحتَلَّ العَنسيُّ صنعاءَ، فذهب معاذُ بنُ جبَلٍ وأبو موسى الأشعريِّ إلى حَضرَموتَ، وانحاز عُمَّالُ رَسولِ الله صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم إلى الطَّاهِرِ، ورجَعَ عُمَرُ بنُ حرامٍ وخالِدُ بنُ سعيدِ بنِ العاصِ إلى المدينةِ، واستوثقَت اليمَنُ للأسودِ العَنسيِّ، وجَعَل أمرُه يستطيرُ استطارةَ الشَّرارةِ، واشتَدَّ مُلكُه، واستغلظ أمرُه، وارتَدَّ خَلقٌ مِن أهلِ اليَمَنِ، وعامَله المسلمون الذين هناك بالتَّقِيَّةِ فبعث رَسولُ اللهِ صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم حين بلغَه خَبَرُ الأسودِ العَنسيِّ كِتابَه مع قيسِ بنِ مكشوحٍ يأمرُ فيه المسلمين الذين هناك بمُقاتلةِ العَنْسيِّ ومُصاولتِه، فقام معاذُ بنُ جَبَلٍ بهذا الكتابِ أتمَّ قيامٍ، واتَّفَق معاذُ بنُ جبَلٍ ومَن التَفَّ حولَه مِن أهلِ اليَمَنِ، وقيسُ بنُ عبدِ يغوثَ أميرُ جندِ الأسوَدِ، وفَيروز الدَّيلميُّ؛ على الفتكِ بالأسوَدِ وقَتْلِه، وتعاقدوا عليه، فلمَّا كان الليلُ دَخَلوا عليه البيتَ؛ تقَدَّم إليه فيروز الدَّيلميُّ، وكان الأسوَدُ نائمًا على فراشٍ من حريرٍ، قد غَرِقَ رأسُه في جَسَدِه، وهو سَكْرانُ يَغطُّ، والمرأةُ جالسةٌ عنده، فعاجله وخالَطَه، وهو مِثلُ الجَمَلِ، فأخَذَ رأسَه، فدَقَّ عُنُقَه ووَضَع رُكبتَيه في ظَهْرِه حتى قَتَلَه، وجلس قيسٌ وداذويه وفيروز يأتمرونَ كيف يُعلِمونَ أشياعَهم، فاتَّفَقوا على أنَّه إذا كان الصَّباحُ ينادون بشِعارِهم الذي بينهم وبين المسلمين، فلمَّا كان الصَّباحُ قام أحَدُهم -وهو قيس- على سُورِ الحِصنِ، فنادى بشِعارِهم، فاجتمع المسلِمون والكافِرون حول الحِصنِ، فنادى قيسٌ: أشهَدُ أنَّ محمَّدًا رسولُ اللهِ، وأنَّ عَبهلةَ كذَّابٌ، وألقى إليهم رأسَه، فانهزم أصحابُه، وتَبِعَهم النَّاسُ يأخُذونهم ويرصُدونهم في كلِّ طريقٍ يأسِرونَهم، وظهر الإسلامُ وأهلُه، وتراجَعَ نوَّابُ رسولِ اللهِ صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم إلى أعمالِهم، واتَّفَقوا على معاذِ بنِ جَبَلٍ يصلِّي بالنَّاسِ، وكتبوا بالخَبَرِ إلى رَسولِ الله صلَّى اللهُ عليه وسلَّم، وكانت مُدَّةُ مُلكِه منذ ظهر إلى أن قُتِلَ ثلاثةُ أشهُرٍ أو أربعةُ أشهرٍ.

title: The birth of the Prophet Muhammad, son of Abdullah, peace be upon him.
details: The biographers and historians have differed in determining the day, month, and year of his birth, peace be upon him, but they agreed that his birth, peace be upon him, was on a Monday in the Year of the Elephant. Ibn al-Qayyim said: "There is no dispute that he was born, peace be upon him, in the heart of Mecca, and that his birth was in the Year of the Elephant." It is narrated from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he said: (The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was born in the Year of the Elephant), and this is what no scholar doubts. Khalifa ibn Khayyat, Ibn al-Jazari, Ibn Dihya, and Ibn al-Jawzi have reported consensus on this. As for his birth on Monday, it is narrated from Abu Qatadah al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: "The Prophet, peace be upon him, was asked about fasting on Mondays. He said: 'That is the day I was born, and the day I was sent (as a prophet) or the revelation was sent down to me.'" Ibn Kathir said: "Far be it, nay, he erred, who said: He was born on Friday the seventeenth of Rabi' al-Awwal." The point of disagreement was in determining the month and the day within it. Ibn Ishaq narrated from a group of the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, that they said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, tell us about yourself." He said: (Yes, I am the supplication of my father Abraham, and the good news of Jesus, and my mother saw when she was pregnant with me that a light emerged from her that illuminated the palaces of Syria for her). His birth, peace be upon him, was after the death of his father Abdullah, as he was a fetus in his mother's womb when his father passed away, so the Prophet, peace be upon him, grew up an orphan. His birth took place in the house of Abu Talib in the valley of Banu Hashim.
location_name: The house of Abu Talib in the Shi'b of Banu Hashim

title: The first incident of the Prophet's chest being opened.
details: Anas bin Malik narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was playing with some boys when Gabriel, peace be upon him, came to him. Gabriel took him and laid him down, then opened his chest and took out his heart. He extracted a clot from it and said, "This is the devil's share of you." Then he washed it in a golden basin with Zamzam water, then sewed it up, and returned it to its place. The boys came running to his mother – meaning his wet nurse – and said, "Muhammad has been killed!" They met him, and his complexion had changed. Anas said, "I used to see the mark of that stitch on his chest."

title: The death of the Prophet's mother, Aminah bint Wahb, and the upbringing of the Prophet, peace be upon him, by Umm Ayman.
details: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, reached six years of age, his mother, the noble Aminah bint Wahb, took him to visit her maternal uncles, Banu Adi ibn al-Najjar, accompanied by his wet nurse, Umm Ayman, may Allah be pleased with her. They were traveling on two camels. His mother disembarked with him at the house of al-Nabighah, near the grave of his father, Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib. She stayed with her relatives for a month, and then his mother returned with him to Mecca. When they reached Al-Abwa, his mother Aminah bint Wahb passed away. Umm Ayman, may Allah be pleased with her – whose name was Barakah bint Tha'labah ibn Hisn – returned with him. Umm Ayman, may Allah be pleased with her, loved the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, with an intense love and cared for him with the utmost attention, protecting him with her care and compassion. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was dutiful to her and treated her kindly. When he grew older, peace and blessings be upon him, he freed her, and then married her to Zayd ibn Harithah, may Allah be pleased with him, by whom she had Usamah ibn Zayd, may Allah be pleased with them both. Umm Ayman, may Allah be pleased with her, passed away five months after the passing of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.

title: The guardianship of Abdul Muttalib over the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and his knowledge of his affairs.
details: When Aminah, the mother of the Messenger, peace be upon him, passed away while he was six years old, his guardianship fell to his grandfather, Abdul Muttalib ibn Hashim. Abdul Muttalib was a man of honor and virtue among his people, and Quraysh called him "Al-Fadl" (the Virtuous) due to his generosity and merit. He assumed the responsibilities of Rifadah (providing food for pilgrims) and Siqayah (providing water for pilgrims) after the death of his father, Hashim ibn Abd Manaf. Abdul Muttalib loved his grandson Muhammad with a great love, preferring him over all his other sons and showing him more tenderness than he showed his own children. Ibn Ishaq, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was with his grandfather Abdul Muttalib ibn Hashim – meaning, after the death of his mother Aminah bint Wahb. A bed would be laid for Abdul Muttalib in the shade of the Kaaba, and his sons would sit around that bed until he came out to it. None of his sons would sit on it out of reverence for him. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, would come as a young boy, strong and full, and sit on it. His uncles would try to pull him away from it, but when Abdul Muttalib saw that, he would say, 'Leave my son; by Allah, he has a great destiny.' Then he would seat him with him on his bed, stroke his back with his hand, and be pleased with what he saw him do." Abdul Muttalib would not eat food unless he said, "Bring my son to me!" and he would be brought to him. When Abdul Muttalib was nearing death, he bequeathed to Abu Talib the care and protection of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.

title: The death of Abdul Muttalib and his bequest of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, to Abu Talib.
details: When the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, reached eight years of age, his grandfather, Abd al-Muttalib, passed away. When Abd al-Muttalib was on his deathbed, he entrusted his son, Abu Talib, with the care and protection of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, and to look after him. He entrusted him to Abu Talib because Abdullah, the father of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and Abu Talib were from the same mother. So, when Abd al-Muttalib died, Abu Talib was the one who took charge of the affairs of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, after his grandfather. Ibn Sa'd and Ibn Asakir narrated from Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them, and others, who said: When Abd al-Muttalib passed away, Abu Talib took the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, and he would stay with him. Abu Talib loved him with an intense love, not loving his own children as much. He would not sleep except next to him, and he would favor him with food. When Abu Talib's children ate together or individually, they would not be full. But if the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, ate with them, they would be full. When Abu Talib intended to give them breakfast or dinner, he would say, "Wait until my son arrives." Then the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, would come and eat with them, and they would have leftovers from their food. If he was not with them, their food would not be enough to fill them. If it was milk, he would drink first, then the children would take a large bowl, like a platter, and drink from it until they were all satisfied from that single bowl. One of them would even drink a whole bowl by himself. Abu Talib would then say, "Indeed, you are blessed!"

title: The Prophet's journey with his uncle Abu Talib to Syria.
details:
When the Prophet, peace be upon him, reached the age of twelve years, his uncle Abu Talib traveled to the Levant on a trade caravan, and he took him along. When the caravan camped at Busra, they passed by a monk there named Bahira, who was knowledgeable in the Gospel and an expert in Christianity. It was there that Bahira saw the Prophet, peace be upon him, and he began to observe him and speak with him. Then he turned to Abu Talib and asked, "Who is this boy to you?" Abu Talib replied, "He is my son." (Abu Talib used to call him his son due to his intense love and compassion for him). Bahira said, "He is not your son, and it is not fitting that the father of this boy should be alive." Abu Talib said, "He is my nephew." Bahira asked, "What happened to his father?" Abu Talib replied, "He died while his mother was pregnant with him." Bahira said, "You have spoken the truth. Return him to his land and beware of the Jews, for by God, if they see him here, they will wish him great harm. For this nephew of yours is destined for a great matter." Abu Talib hastened back to Mecca with him.

Al-Tirmidhi narrated that Abu Talib went out to the Levant, and the Prophet, peace be upon him, went out with him along with some elders of Quraysh. When they approached the monk (meaning Bahira), they dismounted and set up their camp. The monk came out to them. Previously, they used to pass by him, but he would not come out to them or pay them any attention. As they were setting up their camp, the monk went among them until he came and took the hand of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and said, "This is the master of the worlds, this is the Messenger of the Lord of the worlds, whom Allah will send as a mercy to the worlds." Some elders of Quraysh said to him, "What is your knowledge of this?" He replied, "When you approached from the mountain pass, no tree or stone remained but bowed in prostration, and only prophets bow in prostration. And I know him by the Seal of Prophethood below the cartilage of his shoulder, like an apple." Then he went back and prepared food for them. When he brought it to them, and the Prophet, peace be upon him, was tending to the camels, he said, "Send for him." The Prophet, peace be upon him, came, and a cloud shaded him. When he approached the people, he found that they had preceded him to the shade of the tree. When the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, sat down, the shade of the tree moved to cover him. Bahira said, "Look at the shade of the tree, how it has moved to him!" While he was standing among them, he implored them not to take him to the Romans, for if the Romans saw him, they would recognize him by his description and kill him. He looked and saw seven men approaching from the direction of Rome. He met them and asked, "What brings you here?" They said, "We have come because this Prophet is to emerge this month. No road was left without people being sent to it, and we have been informed of his news, so we were sent to this road of yours." He asked, "Did anyone who is better than you precede you?" They said, "We were only informed of his news for this road of yours." He asked, "If Allah wills something to happen, can any person prevent it?" They said, "No." He said, "Then pledge allegiance to him, and they stayed with him." The monk Bahira said, "I adjure you by Allah, who is his guardian?" Abu Talib said, "He kept imploring him until Abu Talib returned him."

title: The War of al-Fijār, and the Prophet's witnessing of it, peace be upon him.
details: When the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, reached fourteen or fifteen years of age, the War of Al-Fijar broke out between Quraysh and those with them from Kinanah, and Qays Aylan. This was one of the greatest days of the Arabs. The cause of this war was that Urwah Al-Rahhal, son of Utbah bin Rabiah, granted protection to a caravan belonging to Al-Nu'man bin Al-Mundhir. Al-Barrad bin Qays, one of the Banu Damrah bin Bakr bin Abd Manat bin Kinanah, said to him, "Will you protect it against Kinanah?" He replied, "Yes, and against all creation." So Urwah Al-Rahhal set out, and Al-Barrad followed him, seeking an opportunity. When they were at Tayman Dhi Dhilal in Al-Aliyah, Urwah was caught unaware. Al-Barrad attacked him and killed him during the sacred month. This is why it was called the War of Al-Fijar. A messenger came to Quraysh and said, "Al-Barrad has killed Urwah during the sacred month at Ukaz." They set out, and Hawazin were unaware. Then the news reached them, and they pursued them, catching up to them before they entered the sanctuary. They fought until nightfall, and then they entered the sanctuary, so Hawazin ceased their pursuit. After this day, the people met for many days, with each tribe of Quraysh and Kinanah having a leader from among them, and each tribe of Qays having a leader from among them. The Messenger of God, peace be upon him, witnessed some of their days, including the Day of Al-Nakhlah, when he was fourteen years old. Some say twenty years old. After their return from it, in Dhu al-Qi'dah, the Pact of Al-Fudul took place. The reason for it was that a man from Zabid, from Yemen, sold goods to Al-As bin Wa'il Al-Sahmi, who delayed paying him the price. The man climbed Mount Abu Qubais and cried out, mentioning his grievance. Quraysh then formed the Pact of Al-Fudul to support the oppressed. The Prophet, peace be upon him, witnessed this pact with them.

title: The Pact of the Virtuous among the tribes of Quraysh.
details: The Hilf al-Fudul (Alliance of the Virtuous) took place in a sacred month. Tribes of Quraysh were called to it: Banu Hashim, Banu Muttalib, Asad ibn Abd al-Uzza, Zuhrah ibn Kilab, and Taym ibn Murrah. They gathered in the house of Abdullah ibn Jud'an al-Taymi, due to his age and nobility. They made a pact and a covenant that if they found anyone oppressed in Mecca, whether from its people or others, they would stand with him and be against whoever oppressed him until his rights were restored. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, witnessed this alliance and said about it: "I witnessed an alliance in the house of Abdullah ibn Jud'an that I would not exchange for a herd of red camels, and if I were called to it in Islam, I would respond." This alliance contradicted the spirit of tribalistic pride that partisanship stirred. It is said that the reason for this alliance was that a man from Zubayd came to Mecca with merchandise, which Al-As ibn Wail al-Sahmi bought from him but withheld his payment. The man sought help from the allied tribes of Abd al-Dar, Makhzum, Jumah, Sahm, and Adi, but they paid him no heed. He then climbed Mount Abu Qubays and called out with verses describing his oppression, raising his voice. Al-Zubayr ibn Abd al-Muttalib then went forth and said, "This cannot be left as is." They gathered and formed the alliance known as Hilf al-Fudul. Then they went to Al-As ibn Wail and retrieved the Zubaydi's right. The reason for its naming is that three men from the Jurhum tribe, namely Al-Fadl ibn Fadalah, Al-Fadl ibn Wada'ah, and Al-Fadl ibn al-Harith, had previously made a similar agreement. When the actions of the Quraysh resembled the actions of these early Jurhumis, all of whom were named Al-Fadl, the alliance was named Hilf al-Fudul.
location_name: The house of Abdullah ibn Jud'an

title: The marriage of the Prophet, peace be upon him, to Khadijah bint Khuwaylid, may Allah be pleased with her.
details:
There are differing opinions regarding the age of the Prophet, peace be upon him, and the age of Khadijah when they married. It has been said that he was twenty-five. It has also been said that he was twenty-seven. And it has been said that he was thirty. And other opinions have been stated. As for the age of Khadijah, the sayings also vary between thirty-five, forty, and other ages.

When Khadijah, may Allah be pleased with her, heard about the Prophet, peace be upon him, his trustworthiness, and his noble character, it is narrated that Khadijah's sister hired the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and his partner for a journey. When they completed the journey, some payment was still due to her. Her partner began to approach them to collect the dues, and he would say to Muhammad, peace be upon him: "Go." Muhammad would reply: "You go, for I feel shy." One time, when her partner came to them, she asked: "Where is Muhammad? Why doesn't he come with you?" He said: "I told him, but he claimed he felt shy." She mentioned this to her sister Khadijah, who said: "I have never seen a man more shy, more chaste, or... than Muhammad, peace be upon him." This impressed Khadijah, so she sent for him and said: "Go to my father and propose to him." He said: "Your father is a man of great wealth, and he will not agree to this." She said: "Go, meet him and speak to him, and I will handle the rest." The Prophet, peace be upon him, married her while she was a widow.

title: The Prophet's journey to Syria for the second time.
details:
When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, reached twenty-five years of age, he had no name in Mecca except "Al-Amin" (The Trustworthy), due to the perfection of his good qualities. His uncle, Abu Talib, said to him: "O nephew, I am a man with no wealth, and times have become harsh upon us, and we have been afflicted by severe years. We have no provisions or trade. Your people's caravan is ready to depart for Syria, and Khadijah bint Khuwaylid is sending men from your people with her caravans to trade her wealth, and they gain profits. If you were to approach her and offer yourself for her business, she would hasten to you and prefer you over others, due to what she has heard of your purity. Although I dislike you going to Syria and fear for you from the Jews, we have no choice."

Khadijah bint Khuwaylid was a merchant woman of noble lineage, great wealth, and extensive trade that she sent to Syria. Her caravans were like those of the rest of Quraysh. She used to hire men and give them money for trade on a profit-sharing basis. News of the Prophet's truthful speech, his great trustworthiness, and his noble character reached Khadijah. So, she sent for him to manage her trade. He set out with her servant Maysarah until they reached Syria. His uncles had instructed the caravan members to look after him until he reached Syria. They camped in the market of Busra, under a tree near the monastery of a monk named Nestorius. The monk looked at Maysarah, whom he recognized, and said: "O Maysarah, who is this who has camped under this tree?" Maysarah replied: "A man from Quraysh, from the people of the Sanctuary." The monk said: "No one has ever camped under this tree except a prophet." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sold his goods, meaning his merchandise, and bought what he intended to buy. He then set off, returning to Mecca with Maysarah. When he arrived in Mecca with Khadijah's wealth, she sold what had come back for double its value or close to it. Maysarah told her about the monk's words and what he had witnessed of the Prophet's affairs. Thereupon, she proposed herself to him, may Allah be pleased with her. She was of the noblest lineage among the women of Quraysh, the most honorable, and the wealthiest. When she said this to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he mentioned it to his uncles. His uncle Hamzah went with him and approached Khuwaylid ibn Asad to propose marriage. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, married her. She was the first woman he married, and he did not marry anyone else until she passed away, may Allah be pleased with her.

title: The Prophet, peace be upon him, places the Black Stone in its place in the Kaaba.
details: From Mujahid, from his freedman, that he told him: I was among those building the Kaaba in the pre-Islamic era... He said: We built until we reached the place of the Stone, and no one saw the Stone. It was in the midst of our stones, like a man's head, such that a man's face could almost be seen in it. Then one clan of Quraysh said: We will place it. And others said: We will place it. They said: Let an arbitrator decide between you. They said: The first man to emerge from the mountain pass. Then the Prophet, peace be upon him, came. They said: The trustworthy one has come to you. They told him, and he placed it in a garment, then he called their clans, and they took hold of its edges with him, and he, peace be upon him, placed it.

title: The first revelation and the prophethood of the Prophet, peace be upon him.
details: The first form of revelation the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) received was true visions in his sleep. He would not see a vision except it would come to pass like the breaking of the dawn. Then, he began to love solitude, so he would retreat to the cave of Hira and worship there. While he was in the cave, Gabriel (peace be upon him) came to him with the divine words: "{Read, [O Muhammad], by which your Lord created (1) Created man from a clinging substance. (2) Read, and your Lord is the most generous. (3) [He] who taught by the pen. (4) Taught man that which he knew not. (5)}" [Al-Alaq: 1-5]. He then recounted this to his wife Khadijah, who in turn told Warqah ibn Nawfal. Warqah confirmed it, saying, "This is the greatest law (Namus) that came to Moses." Then, the revelation ceased for a period. After that, Gabriel returned to him while he was sitting on a chair. The Prophet (peace be upon him) was frightened by him and returned to his family, saying, "Wrap me, wrap me." Then Allah the Almighty revealed: "{O you who enshrouds himself! (1) Arise and warn. (2) And your Lord magnify. (3) And your clothing purify. (4) And uncleanliness abandon. (5)}" [Al-Muddaththir: 1-5]. This marked the beginning of his prophethood and the command to convey the message.

title: The cessation of revelation from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.
details: The revelation ceased from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, for a period of time, which distressed him and saddened him. Then Gabriel came to him with the chapter of Ad-Duha, his Lord swearing to him – and He is the One who honored him with what He honored him – that He had not forsaken him. Al-Bukhari narrated in his Sahih, from the narration of Jundub ibn Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: Gabriel was delayed in coming to the Prophet, peace be upon him. A woman from Quraysh – and she was Umm Jamil, Arwa bint Harb, the sister of Abu Sufyan and the wife of Abu Lahab – said: "His devil has delayed him." Then it was revealed: "By the morning brightness, and by the night when it settles, your Lord has not taken leave of you, nor has He detested you."

title: The first of people in faith in Allah and His Messenger.
details: The first to believe in Allah and His Messenger was Khadijah bint Khuwaylid, his wife, peace be upon him, Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, and Ali ibn Abi Talib. Then Zayd ibn Harithah, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, embraced Islam. Through the invitation of Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, Uthman ibn Affan, al-Zubayr ibn al-Awwam, Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas, and Talhah ibn Ubayd Allah, and Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf embraced Islam. Then Abu Ubaydah ibn al-Jarrah, Abu Salamah ibn Abd al-Asad, and Uthman ibn Maz'un embraced Islam, and then his brothers Qudamah and Abdullah, and his son al-Sa'ib ibn Uthman ibn Maz'un, Asma bint Abi Bakr al-Siddiq, and Aisha bint Abi Bakr al-Siddiq, who was young. Then Khalid ibn Sa'id ibn al-As embraced Islam, and his wife Aminah bint Bint Khalaf ibn As'ad al-Khuzaiyyah embraced Islam with him, and Bilal, Ammar ibn Yasir, and his mother Sumayyah, Suhayb ibn Sinan al-Numayri, known as al-Rumi, Amr ibn Absah al-Sulami, Amr ibn Sa'id ibn al-As, Sa'id ibn Zayd ibn Amr ibn Nufayl, and his wife Fatimah bint al-Khattab, the sister of Umar ibn al-Khattab, Umayr ibn Abi Waqqas, Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, and his brother Utbah ibn Mas'ud, Salit ibn Amr al-Amiri, Ayyash ibn Abi Rabi'ah al-Makhzumi, and his wife Asma bint Salamah ibn Mukharribah al-Tamimiyyah, and Mas'ud ibn Rabi'ah ibn Amr al-Qari from the Banu al-Hun ibn Khuzaymah, who are al-Qarah, and Khunays ibn Hudhafah ibn Qays ibn Adi al-Sahmi, and Abdullah ibn Jahsh al-Asadi. The remaining early believers in the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, are: Ja'far ibn Abi Talib and his wife Asma bint Umays, Amir ibn Rabi'ah al-Anazi, from Anz ibn Wail, an ally of al-Khattab ibn Nufayl, Abu Ahmad ibn Jahsh al-A'ma, Hatib ibn al-Harith ibn Ma'mar al-Jumahi, and his wife Bint al-Mujallil al-Amiriyyah, Hattab ibn al-Harith, his brother, and his wife Fukayhah bint Yasar, and their brother Ma'mar ibn al-Harith ibn Ma'mar al-Jumahi, and al-Muttalib ibn Azhar ibn Abd Awf al-Zuhri, and his wife Ramlah bint Abi Awf al-Sahmiyyah, and al-Nahham, whose name is Nu'aym ibn Abdullah al-Adawi, and Amir ibn Fuheirah, a freed slave of Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, and Hatib ibn Amr ibn Shams ibn Abd Wadd al-Amiri, the brother of Salit ibn Amr, and Abu Hudhayfah ibn Utbah ibn Rabi'ah, whose name is Hisham ibn Utbah...

title: What the Companions suffered from the persecution of Quraysh.
details: The first seven to openly declare their Islam were: the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, Abu Bakr, Ammar, his mother Sumayyah, Suhayb, Bilal, and Al-Miqdad. As for the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, God protected him through his uncle Abu Talib. As for Abu Bakr, his people protected him. As for the rest of them, the polytheists seized them, clothed them in iron armor, and roasted them in the sun. None of them escaped unharmed except that they complied with what the polytheists wanted and deceived them, except for Bilal. His soul was dear to him for the sake of God, the Almighty, and he was insignificant to his people. They seized him, gave him to the children, who paraded him through the valleys of Mecca, while he said: "One, one." They put a rope around his neck and handed him over to the children to play with, until it left a mark on his neck. Bilal belonged to some of the Banu Jumah. The one who took the lead in torturing him was Umayyah ibn Khalaf. He would take him out when the midday heat was intense, throw him on his back in the open ground of Mecca, then order a large rock to be placed on his chest. Then he would say to him: "You will remain like this until you die, or disbelieve in Muhammad and worship Al-Lat and Al-Uzza." While enduring this torture and affliction, he would say: "One, one." It was as if his torture and affliction only increased his faith upon faith. Abu Bakr felt compassion for him when he saw him one day in this extreme humiliation, so he bought him and set him free, and he also freed six others who were being tortured for Islam.

title: The Quraysh asked Abu Talib to restrain the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, from them.
details: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, called to God Almighty in all his states; by night and by day, in secret and in public. Nothing diverted him from this, no one turned him back, and no obstacle prevented him. He followed people to their gatherings, assemblies, and congregations, and during festivals and the pilgrimage seasons, calling to whoever he met, whether free or slave, weak or strong, rich or poor. The disbelievers of his people, the polytheists of Quraysh, oppressed him and those who followed him. Among the harshest of them towards him were his uncle Abu Lahab and his wife Umm Jamil, the firewood carrier – Arwa bint Harb bin Umayya, the sister of Abu Sufyan. His uncle Abu Talib bin Abdul Muttalib, however, was compassionate towards him, treated him well, defended him, and protected him, opposing his people in this matter, even though he remained on their religion. His continued adherence to his people's religion was part of God Almighty's wisdom and a protection He provided for His Messenger. For had Abu Talib embraced Islam, he would have had no standing or influence among the polytheists of Quraysh, nor would they have feared or respected him. The biographers narrated that Quraysh came to Abu Talib and said, "Your nephew has annoyed us in our gathering place and our mosque; stop him from us." He said, "O Aqil, go and bring Muhammad to me." So he brought him in the heat of the afternoon. When he came to them, Abu Talib said, "These cousins of yours claim that you annoy them in their gathering place and their mosque; so cease annoying them." The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, raised his gaze to the sky and said, "Do you see this sun?" They said, "Yes." He said, "Then I am no more able to abandon that than you are to be ignited by a flame from it." Abu Talib then said, "By God, my nephew has never lied. So go back."

title: The First Hijra to Abyssinia.
details: Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her, said: When Makkah became too constricted for us, and the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, were harmed and persecuted, and they saw the afflictions and trials they faced in their religion, and that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, could not ward off that from them, while the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was protected by his people and his uncle, and nothing he disliked reached him that befell his companions. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to them: Indeed, in the land of Abyssinia, there is a king under whom no one is wronged. So go to his land until Allah grants you relief and a way out of what you are in. So we went out to it until we gathered there, and we settled in the best of lands with the best of neighbors, secure in our religion, and we did not fear injustice from him... It is said that their departure to Abyssinia was in Rajab in the fifth year of the Prophetic Mission. Twelve men and four women of the Muslims migrated therein, including Uthman ibn Affan, and he was the first to leave, accompanied by his wife Ruqayyah, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.

title: The Islam of Hamzah ibn Abd al-Muttalib, may Allah be pleased with him.
details: In the latter part of the sixth year of his prophethood, Hamzah ibn Abd al-Muttalib, may Allah be pleased with him, embraced Islam. The reason for his conversion was that Abu Jahl once passed by the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, near Safa, insulted him, and wronged him. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, remained silent, not speaking to him. Then Abu Jahl struck him on the head with a stone, wounding him severely until blood flowed. He then left him and went to the gathering of Quraysh near the Kaaba and sat with them. A slave woman belonging to Abd Allah ibn Jud'an, in her dwelling on Safa, witnessed all of this. Hamzah arrived from hunting, his bow slung over his shoulder. The slave woman informed him of what she had seen Abu Jahl do. Hamzah became enraged and went out running, not stopping for anyone, intending to confront Abu Jahl if he met him. When he entered the Masjid, he stood over Abu Jahl and said, "Do you curse my nephew while I am of his religion!" Then he struck him with his bow, inflicting a terrible wound. Men from Banu Makhzum, Abu Jahl's tribe, rose up, and men from Banu Hashim, Hamzah's tribe, also rose up. Abu Jahl said, "Leave Abu Imarah alone! For I have insulted his nephew with an ugly insult." Ibn Ishaq said: "Then Hamzah returned to his house, and Satan came to him saying: 'You are the chief of Quraysh, yet you follow this apostate and abandon the religion of your forefathers. Death is better for you than what you have done.' Hamzah turned to himself and said: 'What have I done?! O Allah, if this is guidance, then make its confirmation in my heart. Otherwise, grant me a way out of what I have fallen into.' He spent a night such as he had never spent before, tormented by Satan's whispers, until morning. He then went to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and said: 'O nephew, I have fallen into a matter and do not know how to escape it. Is it guidance for someone like me to remain in a state I do not know whether it is right or grievous error? Tell me a story; I have longed, O nephew, for you to tell me.' The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, turned to him, reminded him, admonished him, warned him, and gave him good tidings. Allah then cast faith into his heart regarding what the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, had said. He said: 'I bear witness that you are truthful, a true testimony. Reveal your religion, O nephew, for by Allah, I would not wish to have all that the sky covers if it meant I were to return to my former religion.' Thus, Hamzah's embrace of Islam, may Allah be pleased with him, began as the pride of a man who refused to see his kinsman insulted. Then Allah expanded his chest, and he held fast to the firmest handhold, and the Muslims were greatly strengthened by him!

title: The second migration to Abyssinia.
details: It reached the Emigrants in Abyssinia that Quraysh had embraced Islam, so they returned to Mecca in Shawwal of the same year they had emigrated. When they were a short distance from Mecca, and they learned the truth of the matter, those who wished returned to Abyssinia, and none of the rest entered Mecca except in secret, or under the protection of a man from Quraysh. Then the affliction and torture from Quraysh intensified against them and the Muslims, and their tribes intervened on their behalf. It was difficult for Quraysh to accept what they heard from the Negus about good protection, and the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, saw no alternative but to advise his companions to emigrate to Abyssinia once again. The Muslims prepared for emigration again. Quraysh tried to thwart the second emigration operation, but the Muslims were faster and took refuge with the Negus of Abyssinia before they could be caught. Eighty-three men and eighteen or nineteen women emigrated. Quraysh sent Amr ibn al-As and Abdullah ibn Abi Rabi'ah, before they had embraced Islam, and sent with them valuable gifts for the Negus and his bishops. After they presented themselves to the Negus, they offered him the gifts and said to him: "O King, there have come to your land foolish youths who have abandoned the religion of their people and have not entered your religion, and they have brought a new religion that neither we nor you know. Their noble kinsmen, their fathers, uncles, and tribes, have sent us to you to return them to them, for they are more concerned about them and know best what they have criticized them for." And they rebuked them for it. The bishops said: "The King is right, so hand them over to them, so they can return them to their people and their land." The Negus sent for the Muslims and summoned them. They attended, having agreed to tell the truth, whatever the consequences. The Negus said to them: "What is this religion that you have abandoned your people for, and have not entered my religion or the religion of any of these communities?" Ja'far ibn Abi Talib – who was the spokesman for the Muslims – said: "O King, we were a people of ignorance; we worshipped idols, ate carrion, committed indecencies, severed ties of kinship, mistreated neighbors, and the strong among us devoured the weak." He then enumerated the virtues of what the Prophet, peace be upon him, had brought them, and said: "So we believed him, and we accepted him, and we followed him in the religion of Allah that he brought us. We worshipped Allah alone, associating nothing with Him. We forbade what was forbidden to us, and permitted what was permitted to us. Then our people attacked us, tortured us, and tried to turn us away from our religion, so that we would return to the worship of idols instead of the worship of Allah Almighty, and so that we would permit what we used to permit of evils. When they oppressed us, wronged us, made things difficult for us, and prevented us from practicing our religion, we came to your land, and we chose you over all others, and desired your protection, and hoped that we would not be wronged in your presence, O King." The Negus said to him: "Do you have anything of what he brought from God?" Ja'far said: "Yes." The Negus said: "Then recite it to me." So he recited to him a portion of Surah Maryam. The Negus wept until his beard was wet, and his bishops wept until their scriptures were wet when they heard what he recited to them. Then the Negus said to them: "Indeed, this and what Jesus brought comes from the same source. Go, for by God, I will not hand them over to you, nor will they be able to." (addressing Amr ibn al-As and his companion). They left, and when they left, Amr ibn al-As said to Abdullah ibn Abi Rabi'ah: "By God, tomorrow I will go to him about them with something that will uproot their existence." Abdullah ibn Abi Rabi'ah said to him: "Do not do that, for they have kinship ties, even if they have opposed us." But Amr insisted on his opinion. The next day, he said to the Negus: "O King, they say something great about Jesus, son of Mary." The Negus sent for them and asked them about their belief concerning the Messiah. They were frightened, but they agreed to tell the truth, whatever the consequences. When they entered and he asked them, Ja'far said: "We say about him what our Prophet, peace be upon him, brought us: He is the servant of Allah, His Messenger, His Spirit, and His Word, which He cast to Mary, the pure virgin." The Negus took a twig from the ground and said: "By God, Jesus, son of Mary, did not exceed what you have said with this twig." His bishops grumbled, and he said: "Even if you grumble." Then he said to the Muslims: "Go, you are safe in my land." (Al-Shuyum means safe in the Abyssinian language). Whoever insults you will pay a fine, whoever insults you will pay a fine, whoever insults you will pay a fine. I would not want a mountain of gold if it meant I had harmed one of you. (Al-Dabr means mountain in the Abyssinian language). Then he said to his retinue: "Return their gifts to them, for I have no need of them. By God, Allah did not take bribes from me when He returned my kingdom to me, so I would take bribes in this matter. And He did not obey people concerning me, so I would obey them concerning Him." Umm Salamah said: "So they left him, disgraced and with their mission rejected, and we stayed with him in the best of abodes, with the best of neighbors."

title: The Islam of Umar, may Allah be pleased with him.
details: Al-Tirmidhi narrated in his Sunan, on the authority of Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both), that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "O Allah, strengthen Islam with the more beloved of these two men to You: Abu Jahl or Umar bin Al-Khattab." He said: "And Umar was the more beloved of them to Him." The biographers narrated that Umar once went out, girded with his sword, intending to eliminate the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him). He met a man who asked him, "Where are you going, Umar?" He replied, "I intend to kill Muhammad." The man said, "How can you be safe from Banu Hashim and Banu Zuhrah if you kill Muhammad?" Umar said to him, "I see that you have become a Sabian and abandoned the religion you were upon." He replied, "Shall I not guide you to something astonishing, O Umar? Your sister and your brother-in-law have become Sabians and abandoned the religion you are upon." So Umar went to them, and Khabbab bin Al-Aratt was with them, holding a parchment containing Surah Taha, reading it to them. When Khabbab heard Umar's footsteps, he hid in the house, and Umar's sister, Fatima, concealed the parchment. Umar had heard Khabbab's recitation to them as he approached the house. When he entered, he asked, "What is this murmuring I heard from you?" They replied, "Nothing but conversation we were having amongst ourselves." He said, "Perhaps you have both become Sabians?" His brother-in-law said to him, "O Umar, what if the truth is in a religion other than yours?" Umar lunged at his brother-in-law and beat him severely. His sister came and pulled him away from her husband, and he struck her with his hand, causing her face to bleed. She said, in anger, "O Umar, if the truth is in a religion other than yours, I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah." When Umar despaired and saw the blood on his sister's face, he regretted it and felt ashamed. He said, "Give me this book you have so I can read it." His sister said, "You are impure, and none shall touch it except the purified. Get up and perform ghusl." So he got up and performed ghusl, then took the book and read: "In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful." He said, "These are beautiful and pure names." Then he read Taha until he reached the verse: "Indeed, I am Allah. There is no god but I, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance." He said, "How beautiful and noble is this speech! Guide me to Muhammad." He went to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) and embraced Islam in his presence. Then the Muslims went out with him in two rows until they entered the Masjid. When the Quraysh saw them, they were overcome with a sadness they had never experienced before.

title: The Islam of Tufayl ibn Amr al-Dawsi, may Allah be pleased with him.
details:
The Quraysh used to warn people against listening to the Prophet, peace be upon him. When Tufayl ibn Amr arrived in Mecca, men from Quraysh approached him. Tufayl was a noble man, a poet, and intelligent. They said to him: "O Tufayl, you have come to our land, and this man who is among us has caused us great trouble. He has divided our community and scattered our affairs. His words are like magic that separates a man from his father, a man from his brother, and a man from his wife. We fear for you and your people what has befallen us. So do not speak to him, nor listen to anything he says."

He said: "By God, they continued to persuade me until I resolved not to listen to him or speak to him. When I went to the mosque, I stuffed cotton into my ears, fearing that some of his words might reach me, as I did not want to hear them. I went to the mosque and saw the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, praying by the Kaaba. I stood near him, but God willed that I should hear some of his words. I heard beautiful speech. I said to myself: Woe is me! By God, I am an intelligent and poetic man, and I can distinguish the good from the bad. What prevents me from listening to what this man says? If what he brings is good, I will accept it, and if it is bad, I will abandon it."

He said: "I stayed until the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, went to his house. I followed him, and when he entered his house, I entered after him. I said: 'O Muhammad, your people told me such and such, and they kept frightening me about you until I plugged my ears with cotton so as not to hear your words. Then God willed that I should hear your words, and I heard beautiful speech. Present your message to me.'"

He said: "The Messenger of God, peace be upon him, presented Islam to me and recited the Quran to me. By God, I have never heard more beautiful speech, nor a more just command. So I embraced Islam and bore witness to the truth. I said: 'O Prophet of God, I am a man who is obeyed by my people, and I am returning to them to call them to Islam. Pray to God to grant me a sign that will help me in calling them to it.' He said: 'O God, grant him a sign.'"

He said: "I went out to my people. When I reached a mountain pass that overlooked the settled people, a light appeared between my eyes like a lamp. I said: 'O God, not on my face. I fear they will think it is a disfigurement on my face for leaving their religion.' He said: 'It moved and fell on the head of my staff.' He said: 'The people below began to see that light on my staff like a hanging lamp, as I descended to them from the pass. When I reached them, I stayed among them.'

When I dismounted, my father, an old man, came to me. I said: 'Stay away from me, my father. I am not of you, and you are not of me.' He said: 'Why, my son?' I said: 'I have embraced Islam and followed the religion of Muhammad, peace be upon him.' He said: 'My son, my religion is your religion.' I said: 'Go and wash yourself and purify your clothes, then come, and I will teach you what I have learned.' He went, washed himself, purified his clothes, then came, and I presented Islam to him, and he embraced Islam.

Then my wife came to me. I said: 'Stay away from me. I am not of you, and you are not of me.' She said: 'Why? May my father and mother be sacrificed for you.' I said: 'Islam has separated me from you, and I have followed the religion of Muhammad, peace be upon him.' She said: 'My religion is your religion.' I said: 'Go and purify yourself.' She went and washed herself, then came, and I presented Islam to her, and she embraced Islam.

Then I called Daws to Islam, but they were slow to respond. Then I came to the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, in Mecca, and said to him: 'O Prophet of God, fornication has overcome Daws. Pray to God against them.' He said: 'O God, guide Daws. Return to your people and call them, and be gentle with them.'"

He said: "I continued in the land of Daws, calling them to Islam, until the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, migrated to Medina, and Badr, Uhud, and the Trench passed. Then I came to the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, with those of my people who had embraced Islam with me, while the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, was in Khaybar. I arrived in Medina with seventy or eighty households from Daws, then we joined the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, in Khaybar, and he gave us a share along with the Muslims."

He continued to be with the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, until God granted him victory in Mecca. He was with him in Medina until God took his soul. When the Arabs apostatized, he went out with the Muslims and marched with them until they finished with Tulayha and all the land of Najd. Then he marched with the Muslims to Yamama and was martyred there.

title: The Quraish siege of the Muslims in the Shi'b Abi Talib.
details: When Quraysh resolved to kill the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, all of Banu Abd al-Muttalib agreed to take the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, into their valley and protect him there. It is narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said on the morning of the Day of Sacrifice, while he was in Mina: "Tomorrow we will descend in the valley of Banu Kinanah, where they swore against disbelief." This refers to al-Muhassab, and that is because Quraysh and Kinanah allied against Banu Hashim and Banu Abd al-Muttalib, or Banu al-Muttalib, to not marry them or trade with them until they handed over the Prophet, peace be upon him, to them. So they all entered the valley, both the Muslims and the disbelievers among them.
